text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm and today we are doing dulce de
leche that's right
dulce of Lecce is how translate to
Spanish
it's basically a sweet caramelized milk
really really delicious and so easy to
make gonna take a can of sweetened
condensed milk and from the looks on
that label I believe this is cow's milk
so with a hammer make two little pin
holes with a nail that serves a couple
purposes number one it won't explode in
your face which is you know always a
bonus and it will also allow us to check
the doneness of this okay so what you
wanna do is you want to put that can in
a little pan of boiling water and you
want to keep refilling that with water
otherwise you will run out of water and
it'll burn so keep watering it we're
going to cook this for three to four
hours it cooks a long time see it starts
out white kind of that vanilla color and
as it cooks in that pan of water it will
slowly turn brown and the darker Brown
it gets the thicker you'll dulce de
leche will be so you can cook this a
really long time you get almost like a
thick caramel candy I like to cook it
not so long I like to cook it too kind
of you'll see the color when I on will
speed this up here so you'll see when we
take this off I like to cook it till
it's about this color because and that
cools that gives me just a beautiful
caramel sauce and near the bottom you
have to be careful there's going to be
some darker thicker chunks but that
touched the bottom of our of our pan of
water so what you want to do is dump
this into a into a bowl just take a
whisk and just break up those thick
pieces now since this is still real hot
those are going to kind of whisk in
nicely then when this chills you have a
beautiful homogeneous sauce and it has
such an incredible flavor I like it
better than caramel sauce you use it any
way you use caramel sauce on ice cream
let me slow this down here look at that
oh man alright this is great on just
toast this is great with cookies and
